content.question:
<math alttext="B aqueous plus H C l aqueous is in equilibrium with H B with a positive 1 charge aqueous plus C l with a negative 1 charge aqueous" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mtext>B(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><mtext>HCl(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>⇄</mo><msup><mrow><mtext>HB</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mtext>Cl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

The reaction of a weak base, <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, with <math alttext="H C l" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HCl</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is represented by the equation above. The graph shows the titration curve for <math alttext="25.0 milliliters" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>25.0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>mL</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of an aqueous solution of <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> titrated with <math alttext="0.100 molar H C l" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.100</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>HCl</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. Based on the graph, which of the following best estimates the initial concentration of the solution of the weak base?

skill.text: 5.D: Identify information presented graphically to solve a problem.
